page.title: 12Farming in Morchard Bishop
page.content: The predominant enterprise is 'dairy', exclusively from Fresian and Holstein cows.Beef is an important by-product of the dairy herd,from Hereford, Limonsin and Charolais crosses.Sheep are plentiful and numbers increased in Winter by hoggs bought in from hill areas to fatten on winter grass and also to improve the swards.Silage is the main bulk conservation fodder and is mostly self-fed from clamps.All ploughable land is used and mostly in grassland leys.The fair acreage,of corn grown is almost entirely of winter-feed wheat and barley.Almost all field banks are maintained by the flail hedge trimmer.Average farm size is about 170 acres.Average dairy herd is 80-90 cows.Average field size,8-10 acres.All are family farms.Milk is sold to Express Dairies and collected by tanker.
